result.execSummary:
The defendant Cameron Dejhoure Bateman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Armed Robbery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program but is not eligible the Substance Abuse Program, only after serving the first 2 years of this sentence.
Consecutive to: CONSECUTIVE with any other time being served with credit for 29 days served.
Defendant is eligible for dosage probation.

miscConds.notes: Obtain/maintain full time employment or full time school and part time employment.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may never possess a firearm.

No contact with victims or Subway as specified in the criminal complaint.
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No drug dealing or association with drug community (drug users/dealers or drug houses).

Provide DNA sample.
Cooperate with any and all rules set forth by the probation agent.
Participate in a cognitive thinking program.
Court advised defendant that he/she may not vote until his/her civil rights have been restored.
Obtain AODA assessment and successfully complete follow-up treatment. Random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: No electronic monitoring. No good time. The first 6 MONTHS are STRAIGHT TIME, the last 6 MONTHS the Court will allow for release to the Day Reporting Center for programming.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.addlTxt: Decision and Order Denying Motion for Good Time Credit signed and filed.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. William Brash, Br. 21, for review. crt
Defendant's pro se motion for good time.
Bail Refund Check Packet
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Order to allow defendant to travel to and attend confirmed job interviews and orientations between 8:00 a.m. and 1:00 p.m. in addition to the previously ordered release for employment.

Defendant Cameron Dejhoure Bateman in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense motion for modification of the GPS monitoring to allow for defendant to attend orientations and job interviews between the hours of 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.  Court grants in part and denies in part.  Court allows modification of the GPS monitoring to allow for the defendant to attend confirmed orientations and job interviews between the hours of 8:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m. Monday through Friday.  Defense to draft Order.
Justice Point Report
To Modify Bail.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Allow GPS Exclusions received and filed.
Telephone call received from Attorney Eichenlaub requesting date for a Bail Motion/Modification of Justice Point monitoring.  Matter calendared.

Signed and filed.

Pursuant to a stipulation by all parties in the above-titled case,

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED that Mr. Bateman is allowed to travel to 822 W. Historic Mitchell, Milwaukee, WI from his home of record on May 13, 2015 between 10:00 a.m. and 2 p.m.  After that time his previously ordered conditions of GPS supervision applies.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Bail, filed.

ORDER

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED that Mr. Bateman is allowed to travel to 12400 W. Bluemound Rd., Elm Grove, WI from his home of record on May 06, 2015 between 04:00 am and 10:00 am.  After that time his previously ordered conditions of GPS supervision applies.

SIGNED AND FILED BY THE COURT.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Bail, received.

received, signed, and filed.

ORDER:

Pursuant to stipulation by all parties in the above-titled case,

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED that the defendant in the above-captioned action be allowed to travel to the Applebee's at Bayshore Mall in Glendale, WI between 11 am and 2pm on April 30, 2015.

Defendant Cameron Dejhoure Bateman in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  
Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.  Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.  Case set for Sentencing Hearing on 6-24-15 at 8:30 a.m. before Branch 21.
Justice Point Pretrial Report, received and filed.
TOT Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.  SAME TERMS AND CONDITIONS.

Defendant Cameron Dejhoure Bateman in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

*CASE HEARD WITHOUT CIRCUIT COURT FILE*

Matter before the Court to address outstanding warrant.  Defense scheduled date with the court to walk the defendant.  Defendant admonished by the Court as to gps violations reported on 3-23-15.  State not seeking any change in bail.  The Court orders warrant withdrawn.  The Court orders cash bail of $750.00 CASH BAIL reinstated with same terms.  Case remains set for Plea/sentencing hearing on 4-15-15 at 8:30 a.m. before Branch 21.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
The court ordered any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.

Attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub in court, defendant Cameron Dejhoure Bateman not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Bail/bond hearing and Scheduling conference.  Appearance of the defendant waived for the purpose of today's proceedings.  Bail arguments made by the state and defense.   The Court modifies(lowers) bail to $750.00 CASH with TOT Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.
  Status conference scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Cameron Dejhoure Bateman in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Cameron Dejhoure Bateman in custody.  Alex Mueller for Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for January 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ANKIT P. OR NATVARIA P. AND SUBWAY, 3434 W NORTH AVE. 
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
NO CONTACT ORDER WITH GEOGRAPHIC RESTRICTIONS (NORTHERN BORDER: W. CENTER ST.; SOUTHERN BORDER: N. SHERMAN BLVD.; WESTERN BORDER: W. LISBON AVE. AND EASTERN BORDER: N. 27TH ST.)/OTHER CONDITIONS INCLUDING Supplemental Order setting Forth Conditions of Defendant's Release, for no drugs, no drug paraphernalia, no burglarious tools or no weapons, signed and filed.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Cameron Dejhoure Bateman in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Cameron Dejhoure Bateman in custody.  Sarra M. Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
